synopsis.text: 20-year-old Michiru Amatsuki moves to Tokyo for a new job and decides to live in Stella House Haruno, an all-female boarding house. There she meets a diverse group of women who, despite their differences in age and occupation, bond over a shared enjoyment of food and drink. Each evening the women unwind with conversation and cocktails, leading to amusing drama and camaraderie. Over meals and libations, new arrival Michiru forms friendships with her housemates as she settles into life in the big city. Though their backgrounds vary, at Stella House the women find common ground in life's simple pleasures of good company, tasty cuisine, and quality liquor.
synopsis.author: anthropic.claude-v2:1
